result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome J Glenn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court would consider early termination of probation with recommendation of the Agent.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Any other condition deemed appropriate by Agent.  No violent contact with Latina B.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome J Glenn

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea hearing on May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Attorney Chernin advising the Court the Defendant has retained him as counsel but he is unable to appear due to a scheduled jury trial.

Defendant Jerome J Glenn in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jones advises the Court that the Defendant has recently retained Attorney Chernin and requests the Court set the matter for a plea hearing.  The Defendant requests that the Court set the matter for a plea hearing and that Attorney Chernin be substituted as counsel.  Attorney Chernin to file a stipulation and order for sbustition of counsel.   Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
From Atty Jones dated 3/16/16 requesting jury trial be a court trial and witness(es) defense will call.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person at 04-12-2016 08:15 am
Jury status hearing at 04-06-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Jerome J Glenn in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jones advises the Court that the Defendant is currently involved in treatment and the parties are in negotations.  The Court sets the matter for trial  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Hearing at 01-25-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Jerome J Glenn in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.   Michele Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Jones requesting a hearing be set in 45 days to allow times for negotiations.  Attorney Jones has received discover and an offer.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 12-09-2015 08:30 am
